message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.DM

The paper discusses online learning and optimization algorithms, which are typically studied in the machine learning and optimization communities. The use of betting algorithms and the focus on regret bounds suggest that the paper may belong to the sub-category of machine learning (cs.LG). The use of information theory concepts such as entropy and the Krichevsky-Trofimov estimator suggest that the paper may also belong to the sub-category of information theory (cs.IT). The use of reductions and the focus on algorithmic complexity suggest that the paper may also belong to the sub-category of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). The use of expert advice and the focus on decision making suggest that the paper may also belong to the sub-category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the use of probability theory and the focus on betting suggest that the paper may also belong to the sub-category of discrete mathematics (cs.DM).
